title: Barnwell's early preview of the 2026 quarterback carousel: Which teams might need a new QB1?
content: Will Arizona move on from Kyler Murray? Is the Tua Tagovailoa era over in Miami? And has time already run out on Bryce Young in Carolina?

title: Top 25 free agents for 2026: Ranking players in line to get PAID this offseason
content: We listed the NFL's top 25 pending free agents and gave intel on who might return to their current team.

title: CFP chair steps down amid Baylor allegations
content: Baylor athletic director and College Football Playoff chairman Mack Rhoades is taking a leave of absence from both positions for personal reasons.

title: Skenes denies Yankees report, focused on Pirates
content: Paul Skenes, while accepting the NL Cy Young Award, pushed back against a report that he has told teammates he is eager to move on from the Pirates.

title: Ex-NFL star Brown released from jail, awaits trial
content: Former NFL star wide receiver Antonio Brown walked out of a Miami jail on Thursday, released on $25,000 bail after pleading not guilty to a second-degree attempted murder charge.

title: Leafs' Matthews (lower-body) could miss week
content: Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews could miss up to a week of action with a lower-body injury, coach Craig Berube confirmed on Thursday.

title: Luka on Harrison firing: Just focused on Lakers
content: Luka Doncic, asked for his reaction to the dismissal of the man who traded him from Dallas to Los Angeles, said he is "just trying to move on and focus on what I'm doing here."

title: WR Brown vents about offense, not sorry for stir
content: Hours after video surfaced of him saying things are "a s---show" outside of his family life, an unapologetic A.J. Brown said his discontent is with Philadelphia's offense as a whole, not his own situation.

title: Irish star Hidalgo posts record 16 steals, 44 points
content: Notre Dame star Hannah Hidalgo set a school record with 44 points and broke the NCAA mark with 16 steals to lead the Fighting Irish in a rout of Akron.

title: Jokic puts up 55 to match SGA for season high
content: Nikola Jokic had 55 points, tying the highest-scoring performance in the NBA this season, as the Nuggets beat the Clippers on Wednesday night.

title: 'I can't do it anymore': Tony Elliott contemplated leaving football entirely. Instead, he built a contender
content: The Virginia coach reflects on the personal and professional changes in his life three years after the shooting that killed three of his players.

title: Should Judge or Raleigh win AL MVP? We weigh every type of debate -- and what it means for this year's race
content: The way voters see the MVP award has changed throughout MLB history. Here's how it might apply to 2025.

title: MLB Awards Week predictions, results: Who will win MVP Awards tonight?
content: Baseball's best are collecting their hardware this week. Tonight, the grandest awards are handed out.

title: 'We're all replaceable': Why individual success has not led to wins for Jets' 2022 draft class
content: With three first-round picks in 2022, New York looked as if it were set up to turn around the franchise.

title: The race for No. 1 draft pick: Five teams in the mix, plus their top needs and what's next
content: Five NFL teams have at least 5% odds to land the No. 1 pick in 2026, per our Football Power Index -- the Titans, Browns, Jets, Saints and Raiders.

title: Projecting the 2026 draft order: Giants, Browns move up; Saints, Jets move down

title: Welcome to Area 51: The Spurs duo putting the NBA on notice
content: Victor Wembanyama and Stephon Castle are taking San Antonio to new heights this season on both ends of the floor.

title: NBA rookie rankings: Where do Flagg, Edgecombe and more land early this season?
content: From top-10 picks to late first-round draft steals, who are the top rookies that have impressed so far?

title: What's at stake for Engelbert, Silver, owners and teams in WNBA CBA negotiations
content: From Cathy Engelbert and Adam Silver to WNBA owners, here's what the management side of CBA negotiations is focused on.

title: Brad Marchand, Steven Stamkos and the NHL's other shocking performers so far
content: After one month of the season, these 15 players have been better (or worse) than projected. Will it continue?

title: How the USMNT combats jet lag: Fly kits, supplements, sleep masks
content: Recovery is part of the job for every soccer player, but it's much more complicated when crossing the Atlantic every six weeks to play for the U.S.

title: 'He's an example for everyone': How Casemiro revived his sputtering Man United career
content: Less than a year ago, Casemiro looked finished at the sport's highest level. Now, the question is whether Manchester United can keep him around.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 11
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Jameson Williams and three other upside players to trade for
content: The trade deadline is coming, so we have players to target to get your roster ready for the fantasy playoffs.

title: 'Not good enough': The fall of the Brian Daboll era in New York
content: It wasn't that long ago that Daboll was being praised for the same emotion that proved to be his downfall. How did things come apart?

title: Expert picks, best bets: Finding the value on the talent-rich UFC 322 card
content: Two pairs of pound-for-pound fighters square off in title fights. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: For the family of WWE legend Eddie Guerrero, his shadow still looms large
content: Twenty years after his death, the legendary WWE superstar still exists in the memories of his loved ones.

title: Chewed out by Saban, brushed off by DeBoer, Ty Simpson persevered to lead the Tide
content: After a long wait and a rough start, the Crimson Tide QB has his team poised for a national title bid.

title: How the class of 2027's top QBs fit at their future schools
content: Looking ahead to the top junior QBs, we break down fits for Texas A&M, Ohio State and other top schools.

title: Luka Doncic trolled by teammates after dunk against Hornets
content: According to Basketball Reference, the dunk marked Luka Doncic's third slam in the past two seasons -- two with Los Angeles this season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Spurs tracking West Ham's Bowen
content: Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur are looking at West Ham forward Jarrod Bowen. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Julius Randle leads the Timberwolves in fantasy points
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from Julius Randle, Russell Westbrook and Andrew Nembhard in the months ahead.

title: Universities' Body Suspends Al Falah's Membership After Red Fort Blast
content: The Association of Indian Universities (AIU) on Thursday suspended membership of Al Falah University, which is under scanner in connection with the Red Fort blast case, officials said.

title: 'No Change In Behaviour After Blast': Arrested Kanpur Doctor's Flatmate
content: Dr Abhishek, flatmate of Dr Arif, who has been called in for questioning in connection with the Delhi blast case, on Thursday revealed that there was no change in the doctor's behaviour after the blast occurred.

title: "How Will I Survive Now?" Father Of Auto Driver Who Died In Red Fort Blast
content: A meeting was organised by the survivors of the 2005 Sarojini Nagar blast to commiserate with the families of the latest victims.

title: Beijing Puts $35,000 Bounty On Taiwanese Influencers Over 'Anti-China' Posts
content: Chinese police on Thursday offered bounties of up to $35,000 for help arresting Taiwanese influencers Wen Tzu-yu and Chen Po-yuan on allegations that the pair disseminated "anti-China" content online.

title: Several Injured In Red Fort Blast Suffer Hearing Loss, Pain In Ear
content: Several of those injured in the Red Fort blast are suffering from hearing problems and pain in ear, doctors have said.

title: Upset Over Low Marks, Girl, 14, Jumps To Death From 19th Floor Near Mumbai: Cops
content: A 14-year-old girl jumped to death from the 19th floor of a building in Kalyan near Mumbai because she was upset over getting low marks in an exam, police said.

title: France Lifts Travel Ban On Telegram Founder PavelDurov
content: France has lifted its travel ban on Telegram founder Pavel Durov, who is under investigation over illegal content on his messaging app, judicial sources close to the case said Thursday.

title: 'Ensure Young Ukrainian Men Don't Come To Germany': Chancellor To Zelensky
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said he told Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday that fewer young Ukrainian men should come as refugees to Germany.

title: Bhupesh Baghel's Son's Assets Worth Rs 61 Crore Attached In Liquor Scam Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth Rs 61.20 crore belonging to Chaitanya Baghel, son of former Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel, in connection with the Chhattisgarh liquor scam.

title: US Proposal Could Halve Biocon's Biosimilar Development Costs
content: India's Biocon expects a 50% drop in costs for developing complex biosimilars as the United States has proposed to ease clinical testing for the drugs that make up more than 60% of its revenue, a top executive said on Wednesday.

title: 32 Bikers And Locals Clash In Kuki Village In Manipur; Incident Not Communal, Say Cops
content: A group of bikers and locals clashed after an altercation over dangerous driving and noise at a village of the Kuki tribe in Manipur's Ukhrul district, the police said.

title: Fake Teacher Recruitment Scam Busted In Madhya Pradesh Government Schools
content: The Special Task Force of Madhya Pradesh has uncovered a major recruitment scam in government schools, where appointments were allegedly made using fake DEd (Diploma in Education) marksheets forged in the name of the Board of Secondary Education.

title: RJD Leader Faces Case For 'Provocative Remarks' Hours Before Bihar Counting
content: The Bihar Police is preparing to take major action against RJD MLC Sunil Singh, the close aide of Lalu Prasad Yadav, after he allegedly made inflammatory remarks on the eve of the Bihar Assembly election results.

title: Tej Pratap Yadav: The Turbulent Life Of Lalu Yadav's Expelled Son
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, the son of former Bihar chief ministers Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi, will be going solo in the state elections.

title: Andhra Official Loses Rs 2 Lakh To Frauds Posing As Anti-Corruption Officers
content: A cyber fraud targeted a government official in Andhra Pradesh's West Godavari district, who was allegedly duped of Rs 2 lakh by criminals posing as Anti-Corruption Bureau officials.

title: Noida's Jewar Airport To Soon Start Flight Operations: Tata Projects
content: Tata Projects, the infrastructure and construction arm of Tata Group, on Thursday said the upcoming Noida International Airport at Jewar, in Uttar Pradesh, will soon begin operations and asserted that the approvals are in progress.

title: Suicide Bomber Involved In Islamabad Blast Was Afghan National
content: Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi on Thursday said that the suicide bomber involved in the deadly Islamabad bombing was an Afghan national.

title: Video: Man Steps Out Of Rs 8 Lakh Car, Steals Newspaper Worth Rs 8
content: In a bizarre incident from Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri, a man driving a Rs 8-lakh car was caught on camera stealing a newspaper worth just Rs 8 from outside a lawyer's office.

title: CEO Captures Mamdani, Elizabeth Warren In "Deep Debate" From Office Window
content: Co-founder and CEO of fintech company Extend posted a surprising scene outside his office window. New York City's mayor-elect, Zohran Mamdani, "in a deep debate" with US Senator Elizabeth Warren.

title: Air India's Toronto-Delhi flight gets bomb threat; flight lands safely in national capital
content: The message was received at around 11:30 a.m. when the flight, operated with a Boeing 777 aircraft, was mid-air and was little over four hours away from Delhi

title: How is SEC ensuring fair elections? | Explained
content: How will Maharashtra’s State Election Commission tackle duplicate and missing entries? Who can raise objections and how will they be resolved? Will the Opposition’s concerns on the electoral rolls be addressed? What steps ensure voters don’t cast multiple ballots?

title: Five held for fabricating false case against police officer in Guntur
content: Police are on the hunt for BRK News Channel reporter Kanneganti Arun Babu who masterminded the plan to implicate Circle Inspector Matangi Srinivasa Rao after the latter refused to pay him money, says SP

title: Supreme Court wants government to promote EVs amid high air pollution
content: The top court suggested that the government could start pilot projects in metros to promote the use of EVs; the Centre said a complete shift to EVs is a major policy decision

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on plea seeking compensation for deaths ‘linked’ to COVID-19 vaccines
content: Petitioners allege that their daughters died of brain clots after vaccination; counsel says information about after-effects was suppressed

title: Central Trade Unions reject draft labour policy, ask govt. to convene Indian Labour Conference
content: In a joint response, CTUs said the new draft labour policy appeared to be less a roadmap for worker empowerment, and more an ideological project to redefine labour, not as a right but as a ‘sacred duty’; Labour Minister assured draft could be changed after consultations

title: Calcutta High Court disqualifies politician Mukul Roy from West Bengal Legislative Assembly under anti-defection law
content: Roy joined the Trinamool Congress in June 2021 after being elected as an MLA from the Krishnanagar Uttar constituency on a BJP ticket.

title: Centre suspends over 4000 fertiliser distributor licences on hoarding charges
content: The Union Department of Fertilisers said it conducted a comprehensive drive with the Union Agriculture Ministry to protect farmer interests and secure the national fertiliser supply chain

title: Teacher suspended, booked for refusing to sing Vande Mataram
content: The petition alleges that the teacher was involved in a verbal confrontation over the singing of Vande Mataram

title: Rise in diabetic foot condition: Doctors now employ AI for early detection
content: AI-powered Diabetic Foot Care and Research Centre will be launched at the Government Nandi Medical College Hospital in Chikkaballapur on World Diabetes Day observed on November 14

title: Supreme Court protects 314 sq. km of pristine sal forest in Jharkhand’s Saranda
content: Home to tribal communities and endangered wildlife, Saranda forest division also accounts for 26% of India’s iron ore reserves; State initially sought smaller sanctuary, but later clarified there are no mines in the extended area

title: Indian agencies monitoring Pakistan’s tech transfer deal with European drone maker
content: After Operation Sindoor, Pakistan military officers got in touch with drone manufacturers in Russia, Ukraine and other European countries for military grade medium-altitude long-endurance drones

title: Congress asks Election Commission to allow more time for SIR in Chhattisgarh
content: In six points, the Opposition party said there is a need to ensure transparency, and widespread public participation in the electoral roll revision, highlighting issues related to logistics and timing

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹61.2 crore belonging to Baghel’s son
content: The police investigation has revealed that Chhattisgarh liquor scam resulted in a massive loss to the State exchequer and filled the pockets of the beneficiaries with Proceeds of Crime (POC) generated by the commission of scheduled offences, worth more than ₹2500 crore

title: Telangana urges Centre to relax procurement norms of cotton, maize, soybean
content: Agri. Minister Tummala Nageswara Rao writes to Union Agri. Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Textiles Minister Giriraj Singh

title: IT policy 2025-30: Karnataka to pump in ₹967 crore towards incentives
content: It seeks to bring investments with special focus on AI and other emerging technologies in cities beyond Bengaluru, and elevate Karnataka’s brand globally as AI-native destination

title: NC, PDP react sharply to notice asking housing societies to register Kashmiris, foreigners with Gurugram police
content: ‘Such orders will only result in unnecessary harassment of innocent Kashmiris across the country and Gurugram, something that must be avoided,’ NC leader and MLA Tanvir Sadiq said

title: Expose those who give shelter to terrorists: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha
content: At the second special convocation of University of Jammu, Mr. Sinha says security forces are determined to dismantle the terror ecosystem but society too must join the fight and discharge its duties

title: Commuters urge BMTC to adopt NCMC as Bengaluru lags on unified mobility
content: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd. (BMRCL) and RBL Bank began issuing NCMC cards on March 25, 2023, coinciding with the inauguration of the Whitefield–Krishnarajapura metro line.

title: Local body polls: Final picture likely to emerge soon in Kozhikode
content: While the LDF declared most of its candidates for the district panchayat, the Congress announced its second list of nominees, including filmmaker V.M. Vinu, for the Kozhikode Corporation

title: Puttaparthi comes under security blanket ahead of Sri Sathya Sai Baba’s birth centenary celebrations
content: While Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit on November 19, President Droupadi Murmu and Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan will be arriving on November 22 and 23 respectively

title: Kerala govt. discontinues practice of appointing Senior Professors
content: Designation of Senior Professor was granted to those who had served at least 10 years as Professor and qualified through a special interview process

title: Miscreants set fire to sugarcane tractors in Bagalkot amid farmers’ protest
content: Protesting farmers claim that they were not involved in the violence and there was an effort to frame them

title: Watch: Why Tamil Nadu wants political parties to pay for rallies? | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: The Tamil Nadu government has issued a new set of draft rules for political parties in Tamil Nadu to hold public meeting. What are the SOPs and how are parties reating to them?

title: ECI all set for counting day in Bihar after record turnout
content: RJD MLC says ECI will face people’s wrath if it tries to “forcefully defeat” the winning candidates; JD(U) poster of CM says ‘Tiger Abhi Zinda Hai’, counter poster at RJD office proclaims ‘Alvida chacha’

title: Kerala decides to forfeit revenue from Azhikkal port for 35 years to woo investors
content: A Chief Secretary-level meeting held recently decided to introduce changes to the concessionaire agreement saying that the project is unlikely to attract expressions of interest from private sector as per the previous condition

title: India’s 2025 carbon emissions rise lower than last year, says report
content: Last year, India’s emissions grew by 4%, but favourable monsoon, which brought down demand for cooling, and a growth in renewable energy have reduced coal use, restricting the increase to 1.4%

title: Red Fort blast and an inter-State terror module: What we know
content: As multiple agencies join the dots from Kashmir, Haryana, Delhi and Uttar Pradesh to draw out a terror plot centred around three doctors from South Kashmir, here's what we know so far based on what officials have said

title: TTD pushes for superior quality of rice in  preparation of ‘annaprasadams’
content: TTD Additional Executive Officer Venkaiah Chowdary directs officials to approve rice consignments only after ensuring sampling and boiling tests, in strict adherence to the prescribed quality standards

title: APSRTC employees’ unions thank govt. for reimbursing ₹400 crore towards Stree Shakti scheme
content: They appeal to the government to purchase additional buses and fill vacant posts for successful continuation of the free travel scheme

title: Local body polls 2025: NDA announces second list of candidates for Thiruvananthapuram
content: BJP fields Hindu Aikyavedi district president A. Kasturi from Thycaud ward against G. Venugopal of the LDF and M.R. Manoj of UDF.

title: Injustice, disempowerment lead to radicalisation: Mirwaiz
content: A spokesman of the Mirwaiz said the cleric said he was committed to “peace and dialogue as the most humane and effective means of addressing issues and resolving differences”

title: Kerala HC directs State govt. to decide on jailed Maoist leader’s request to publish book he wrote in prison
content: Roopesh T.R., an alleged Maoist leader and a UAPA convict, wrote Bandhitharude Ormakurippukal (Memoirs of the Incarcerated), while in prison

title: Aland voter fraud case: SIT makes first arrest
content: Man who ran two portals that provided Kalaburagi-based firm with untraceable credentials and OTPs has been arrested

title: 33 members of gang of global fraudsters arrested in Belagavi
content: CEN Police, following a tip-off, raid a call centre involved in financial fraud, impersonation of officials in the U.S., etc.

title: Hunger stir launched seeking closure of poultry waste rendering unit at Ambayathode
content: Karshaka Congress leader Biju Kannanthara, who recently filed a petition against DIG Yathish Chandra, opened the strike at Ambalamukku

title: Conservationists urge Kerala Governor to withhold assent to contentious wildlife Bill
content: Mass petition raises concerns over the Bill’s potential to undermine the State’s wildlife protection laws and disrupt the country’s ecological security

title: Sugarcane price fixed at ₹2,900 per tonne in Bidar
content: The decision was taken at a meeting of representatives of sugarcane growers and sugar factory managements

title: A.P. ministers reiterate coalition government’s priority to address agrarian issues
content: We are working out concrete modules to ensure MSP to the predominant horticulture crops in the region and thereby prevent crop loss, says Civil Supplies Minister

title: MoUs worth ₹2.94 lakh crore signed in renewable energy sector in Andhra Pradesh
content: They are expected to generate over 69,800 employment opportunities in various districts, says Chief Secretary Vijayanand

title: Repair work in progress at Moolamattom power plant in Idukki
content: Leakage in the main intake valves of generators 5 and 6 is being fixed. The annual maintenance of the two generators is also being taken up simultaneously

title: Hearing what children have to say on Children’s Day
content: Women and Child Development department will organise ‘Njangalum Parayaam’ on November 14, Children’s Day, to garner children’s opinion in connection with realising the goal of child-secure Kerala

title: Congress leaders meet Haryana Governor on crop damage, demand probe
content: Fields of paddy, cotton, and other kharif crops were submerged, causing severe economic hardship for farmers, but the BJP government was yet to conduct a survey or announce compensation, former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda said

title: Karnataka High Court upholds cognisance of offences taken by trial court in POCSO case against Yediyurappa
content: I do not see any error in the manner in which the trial court has taken cognisance of the offences alleged against the accused and the process that has been issued: Justice Arun

title: 'Aware of potential': US after India calls Delhi blast 'terror attack'; Shah vows 'msg to world'
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio acknowledged the Delhi car bomb blast near Red Fort as a "heinous terror incident" with potential to escalate. He commended India's "measured" and "professional" investigation into the explosion that claimed 13 lives. Rubio stated the US offered assistance but believes India is capable of handling the probe effectively.

title: US swings from govt shutdown to opening Epstein files
content: The US government reopened after a 43-day shutdown, but attention quickly shifted to newly released Jeffrey Epstein documents. These emails reportedly ensnare President Trump, with one detailing Epstein's interactions with Trump and a sex trafficking victim. While the White House dismissed the disclosures as a "fake narrative," Democrats are pushing for the release of thousands more pages.

title: Train Americans and go home: New US mantra for H-1B visa holders
content: The Trump administration is signaling a shift in foreign guest worker visa programs like H-1B, aiming to train American workers and then send foreign laborers home. This policy change follows backlash from the MAGA base, which views the administration's openness to foreign talent as a betrayal. Officials emphasise short-term skill transfers and stricter visa enforcement.

title: Islamabad blast: PCB says Pak army chief Asim Munir convinced SL to continue tour
content: Pakistan's Army chief, Asim Munir, personally intervened to ensure Sri Lanka's cricket tour continued after a recent suicide attack.  Interior minister Mohsin Naqvi revealed Munir spoke directly with Sri Lankan officials, reassuring them about security.  Despite initial player hesitation following the Islamabad blast, the tour will proceed with enhanced security measures in Rawalpindi.

title: Nvidia exec misses China: 'Half the world's engineers there'; highlights talent loss
content: Global tech leaders at Web Summit 2025 discussed AI and hardware dominance amidst U.S. export restrictions on advanced chips to China. Nvidia's VP highlighted China's significant role in AI development, warning that exclusion could hinder global progress and innovation. The U.S. government confirmed its stance against selling cutting-edge AI chips like Blackwell to China.

title: India, Russia discuss ways to boost trade; marine and pharma products in focus
content: India has urged Russia to expedite the approval of domestic establishments and registration of marine and pharmaceutical products to boost bilateral trade. During a Moscow visit, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal highlighted opportunities for expanding trade and improving market access, aiming to raise bilateral trade to $100 billion by 2030.

title: 'Loyalty undermines democracy': Tharoor calls out leader worship; jibe at Cong?
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor stated that a growing culture of loyalty to political leaders over principles is weakening India's democracy. He observed that increasingly polarized public discourse leaves little room for serious engagement with political values. Tharoor's remarks highlight his recurring call for politics rooted in principles rather than personality.

title: Microsoft on AI dominance: CEO ready to face Google's threat; how OpenAI is helping
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella confirmed the company has access to all of OpenAI's intellectual property except consumer hardware, bolstering its AI capabilities against Google. While Microsoft's own Maia AI chip production faces delays until 2026, OpenAI is pursuing a multi-pronged chip strategy, including partnerships with Nvidia, AMD, and Google, alongside developing its own chips with Broadcom.

title: Delhi blast: Inside Building 17 of Al Falah University — how it links multiple suspects
content: Diaries and notebooks seized from Al-Falah University rooms belonging to Dr Umar Mohammad and Dr Muzammil Ganaie have revealed a terror network of over 25 individuals. Coded entries, cryptic dates, and mentions of 'operation' suggest a larger, well-orchestrated plan for multi-city attacks, with fundraising of Rs 20 lakh for operational expenses.

title: Gymkhana 'religious conversion' row: Jemimah breaks silence; calls allegation 'false'
content: The controversy began in October 2024 when Khar Gymkhana terminated Rodrigues’ playing membership, alleging that her father had used her membership to book a hall for religious activities. Rodrigues, who became the first woman cricketer to receive membership in March 2023, denied any wrongdoing. Rodrigues described the incident as one of the most difficult moments of her career.

title: 'B'desh-like uprising': RJD leader's shock remark on eve of Bihar poll results; FIR filed
content: Ahead of Bihar election results, RJD leader Sunil Singh was booked for an "inflammatory" remark, warning of Nepal-like unrest if candidates were "made to lose." This comes as exit polls predict a win for the NDA, with projections showing the Mahagathbandhan falling short of a majority. Police are on alert to prevent any untoward incidents.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief's advice for teens; 'spend time on this skill'
content: Meta's Chief AI Officer Alexandr Wang urges teenagers to master AI tools, comparing the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding' – hands-on experimentation with AI – to gain a significant advantage in the future economy, much like early programmers did.

title: 'Ravichandran Romano' urges caution after Shardul trade tongue slip
content: "Trading is subject to rumour risk. Upload all trade-related videos carefully!" Ashwin said in a post on X while responding to a clip of the viral video uploaded by the Mumbai Indians on their official X handle with the caption: "News confirmed by Ravichandran Romano last afternoon - Yes, we have secured the signing of Shardul Thakur from LSG!"

title: Delhi blast: AIU suspends Al-Falah University’s membership
content: The Association of All Indian Universities has suspended Al-Falah University's membership. This action follows the detention of the university's doctors in connection with the recent Delhi blast. The university is no longer authorised to use the AIU name or logo. Al-Falah University also faces a show-cause notice from NAAC for accreditation claims.

title: Olympic legend Surya Bonaly loses all medals to Las Vegas thieves
content: Olympic figure skater Surya Bonaly is devastated after thieves stole all her career medals while she was in Minnesota caring for her mother, who is also battling cancer. The burglary at her Las Vegas home revealed broken windows and destroyed security cameras, with surveillance footage indicating multiple individuals were involved over several days.

title: Lamar Jackson injury update: Ravens QB expected to play vs Browns Sunday
content: Baltimore Ravens fans anxiously await Lamar Jackson's return for Sunday's crucial game against the Cleveland Browns. Despite a recent knee soreness, coach John Harbaugh expressed optimism, assuring it's unrelated to his previous hamstring injury. If Jackson can't play, backup Tyler Huntley, familiar with the Browns, is ready to step in, as the Ravens aim to extend their winning streak.

title: A’ja Wilson surprises 4-year-old superfan with unforgettable birthday moment
content: WNBA star A'ja Wilson made a young fan's birthday unforgettable. Appearing on The Jennifer Hudson Show, Wilson surprised four-year-old Iman Taylor. She turned his birthday wish into reality, gifting him a signed jersey and her signature sneakers. This heartwarming gesture brought tears to many eyes. Wilson's kindness extends beyond the court, inspiring fans with her impactful actions.

title: 'Age trolls': Vaibhav Suryavanshi's two-word response goes viral - watch
content: Teenage sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, one of the youngest prodigies in Indian cricket, was the subject of light-hearted banter from older teammates Yudhvir Singh Charak and Gurjapneet Singh ahead of the ACC T20 Emerging Teams Asia Cup. The viral video captured the players teasing the 14-year-old about his age and hairstyle as the India A squad traveled to Doha.

title: Hybrid for juniors, classroom for seniors: Teachers and principals debate Delhi’s AQI-driven divide
content: Delhi schools are implementing hybrid learning for younger students and offline classes for seniors due to severe air pollution. Educators express mixed views, with some supporting the protection of vulnerable children and others questioning the age-specific approach and its practical challenges. The decision highlights the ongoing tension between health and academic needs.

title: Pune road accident: Truck rams multiple vehicles; six dead, several injured
content: Tragedy struck near Navale Bridge as a container truck's loss of control led to a devastating accident on the Pune–Bengaluru Highway. Six lives were lost and at least eight sustained injuries when the truck collided with multiple vehicles, igniting a fierce blaze.  Authorities are investigating the cause while prioritizing the care of the injured.

title: IPL Trade: Washington Sundar set for bigger role at GT; Sherfane Rutherford released
content: Washington Sundar is in line for a bigger role after GT rejected CSK’s trade offer. The 26-year-old’s rise across formats has impressed the management and the trade of West Indies batter Sherfane Rutherford further explains that. Gujarat Titans are set for a quiet IPL 2026 auction, with captain Shubman Gill and coach Ashish Nehra keen to retain their core.

title: Delhi blast: Sadar, Chandni Chowk markets falls silent; footfall drops drastically
content: Central Delhi's wholesale markets are experiencing a significant downturn following a blast near the Red Fort. Outstation buyers are increasingly opting for online purchases, leading to a 50% drop in footfall at Sadar Bazaar and Chandni Chowk. While Sarojini Nagar market remains unaffected, Lajpat Rai Market is largely shut, with traders expressing fear and livelihood concerns.

title: '32 vehicles with explosives': Agencies uncover chilling plot; details of Delhi blast case
content: Intelligence agencies have uncovered a wider terror plot linked to the Delhi Red Fort car explosion, revealing plans to rig 32 vehicles for coordinated attacks across multiple cities. Investigations revealed suspects were modifying vehicles and preparing to execute serial blasts with multiple IEDs, with eight suspects working in pairs assigned to specific cities.

title: ‘Supporting terrorists’: BJP flays Chidambaram; slams ‘homegrown terror’ remark
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has strongly criticized Congress leader P Chidambaram for his comments on homegrown terrorists. Union minister Giriraj Singh accused Chidambaram of supporting terrorists and appeasement politics. BJP MP Praveen Khandelwal stated that terrorists have no religion and questioned Chidambaram's past actions. National spokesperson Nalin Kohli alleged Chidambaram is building a political narrative.

title: 'Dog that hasn't barked': Do new Epstein files exonerate Trump?
content: At first glance it looked explosive. But the closer the messages were read, the more they collapsed under their own weight. No accusation was made. No crime was alleged. No victim testimony was cited. The only thing that barked was political theatre.

title: IPL: Mumbai Indians confirm Shardul Thakur's trade from LSG
content: Shardul Thakur is set to join Mumbai Indians for the 2026 IPL season, with the franchise officially confirming the trade from Lucknow Super Giants. This move marks Thakur's seventh IPL team. The announcement comes ahead of the player retention and release announcements scheduled for Saturday. Mumbai Indians will become the seventh IPL franchise that Shardul has represented.

title: Yunus powergrab? B'desh to hold referendum in Feb; what is July Charter?
content: Bangladesh's interim chief adviser Muhammad Yunus announced a national referendum on the "July Charter" for state reform will be held alongside parliamentary elections in February 2026. The charter, born from a student uprising, proposes significant institutional changes. This move occurs amidst heightened political tensions following former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's trial.

title: Dhoni or Kohli? Harmanpreet Kaur picks her favourite, crowd goes berserk - watch
content: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur, fresh off leading India to their maiden ICC Women's Cricket World Cup title, revealed MS Dhoni as her favourite cricketer over Virat Kohli. Speaking to students, she also expressed her admiration for Virender Sehwag and pride in the growing recognition of women's cricket. India’s journey to the title was challenging.

title: 'Punishment will be message to world': Shah vows action against Delhi blast culprits
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah vowed the "strictest possible punishment" for those responsible for the recent Delhi bomb blast, emphasizing that the action will deter future attacks. He assured that all perpetrators will be brought to justice, sending a strong global message against terrorism. Shah also expressed condolences to the victims' families following the incident near the Red Fort.

title: Asmongold sparks controversy as Trump faces new pressure over Epstein files
content: Zach Hoyt, known as Asmongold, spoke about pressure on Donald Trump to release Epstein documents. He suggested releasing files would bring clarity. Asmongold noted that hiding information fuels public doubt. His comments highlight how online personalities engage in national discussions. The debate over these files now reaches beyond political circles.

title: Employee skips meeting during leave: Boss disappointed; sparks debate on work culture
content: An Indian employee's resignation after being asked to attend a meeting on approved leave sparked widespread discussion.  This incident highlights a growing trend of work encroaching on personal time, with many professionals feeling pressured to be constantly available.  The article explores the toll of overcommitment culture and the emerging demand for better work-life balance and mutual respect.

title: 'Not every Kashmiri is a terrorist': J&K CM reacts to Delhi car blast probe
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah asserted that not all residents of the region are terrorists, following the Red Fort car blast probe widening to Kashmir. The investigation revealed a Turkiye-based handler, codenamed Ukasa, directed the module, which included professionals like doctors and a cleric who allegedly radicalized students.

title: Hack of the day: RBI UDGAM: How to find unclaimed money in your family
content: Discover unclaimed money in your family's name through the RBI's UDGAM portal. Simply use basic details like name and date of birth to search across numerous banks. If a match surfaces, reclaim your funds by visiting the bank with necessary documents. This initiative helps reunite individuals with forgotten deposits, ensuring rightful owners can access their money.

title: Delhi blast: 3rd terror car found; bomb squad at Al-Falah University
content: Investigators discovered a Maruti Suzuki Brezza near Al Falah University as part of the Delhi blast probe. Security sources revealed the bomber, Umar Un Nabi, planned a multi-vehicle IED attack, with three vehicles acquired for the operation. The plot, originating in Turkey, also targeted locations beyond Delhi, including Ayodhya.

title: Happy Children’s Day 2025: Best wishes, messages, quotes and images
content: Children's Day, celebrated annually on November 14th, honors the joy, curiosity, and love children bring. This year, in 2025, the occasion serves as a reminder to cherish childhood and nurture young dreams. The article offers heartfelt wishes and messages to celebrate every child's uniqueness and the special spirit of this day.

title: Red Fort blast probe: Dr Adil’s Srinagar-Delhi flight traced; ticket recovered
content: A flight ticket found in Saharanpur links Dr. Adil Ahmad, arrested last week, to a Srinagar-Delhi trip just before the Red Fort blast. The Jammu and Kashmir native, a qualified doctor, is under scrutiny for potential ties to terror outfits like Jaish-e-Mohammed. Investigators are probing his movements and contacts in Delhi.

title: Ishan Kishan to Mumbai Indians? Ex-India player’s bold statement stirs fans
content: Ishan Kishan's IPL 2025 campaign saw a strong start but a subsequent dip in form for Sunrisers Hyderabad. Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif suggests Kishan's struggles stem from batting at number three, advocating for a return to Mumbai Indians where he can open. This move, Kaif believes, would benefit both the player and MI.

title: IPL: Top 10 players who might be released; 2026 retention deadline inches closer
content: IPL 2026 retention deadline approaches, with teams finalizing squads by November 15. A blockbuster trade involving Sanju Samson, Ravindra Jadeja, and Sam Curran has already been reported. Several high-profile players, including Mohammed Shami, Venkatesh Iyer, and Deepak Chahar, are among the top 10 potentially facing release due to form, injury, or cost.

title: 'Will call it blast': Cong slams Centre over delay in 'terror' tag; seeks all-party meet
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has criticized the government for its delayed response to the Delhi car blast near Red Fort, questioning national security and intelligence failures. He highlighted the 48-hour delay in classifying the incident as a terrorist act, which claimed 13 lives. Khera urged an All-Party Meeting to address security concerns, drawing parallels to the 2001 Parliament attack and emphasizing the need for accountability.

title: Codename 'Ukasa': Turkiye handler directed Delhi terror module; how bomber's 2022 trip became key
content: A Turkiye-based handler, codenamed Ukasa, allegedly directed a terror module led by Al-Falah University professor Umar Un Nabi in a plot hatched in 2022. The group, linked to JeM and AGuH, planned spectacular attacks in India, including at Red Fort and Ayodhya, using vehicle-borne IEDs and explosives.

title: Delhi blast: AAP claims 'new plaster, costume' for victim before PM visit; BJP fumes
content: BJP Delhi refuted AAP's claims of fabricating Prime Minister Modi and Chief Minister Gupta meeting the same patient in different conditions. BJP clarified that the CM met the patient immediately after the incident, while the PM visited after the patient had received treatment, calling AAP's allegations 'dirty politics'.

title: Matthew and Brady Tkachuk launch ‘Wingmen’ podcast, join NHL trend
content: NHL stars Matthew and Brady Tkachuk have launched their new podcast, 'Wingmen,' in partnership with Wave Sports & Entertainment. The weekly show promises candid off-ice stories and behind-the-scenes insights from two of the league's most prominent personalities. This initiative aims to provide a much-needed player-driven platform for fans to connect with the sport's stars.

title: UWCL talking points: What's wrong with Arsenal? Was Earps upstaged?
content: UEFA women's champions league (UWCL) saw more exciting matchups . OL Lyonnes beat VfL Wolfsburg 3-1, real madrid thrashed st. pölten 6-0 . the match saw a 3-2 comeback win over arsenal and a 1-1 draw .

title: Patriots', Rams' Rivalries uniforms top NFL Week 11 threads
content: the new England Patriots will rock their "Nor'easter" threads against the new york Jets on "Thursday Night Football" the storm blue jerseys are matched with white pants and matte white helmets . it's the first time the Rams will wear "midnight navy"

title: CFP rankings release: See the second top 25 and bracket
content: the college football playoff committee will release its rankings each Tuesday through the end of the regular season . the final set of rankings will be released on Dec. 7 and those rankings will determine the final 12-team bracket . based on the CFP top 25 .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Reranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: Who rose and who fell after two months
content: a new app lets you watch your favorite events in the newly enhanced ESPN App . the new app will help you figure out who the best quarterbacks will be in a given season . it's a good idea of this year's hierarchy with just three regular-season Saturdays to go .

title: Women's Power Rankings: The 16 best teams so far
content: the first edition of ESPN's women's college basketball Power Rankings for 2025-26 . the top four teams in our initial rankings are the programs that went to the Final Four last season . of that group, UCLA has the most impressive victory so far: 73-59 over fellow top-10 team Oklahoma on Monday .

title: Isak, Gyökeres, Sesko have struggled. What happened to the summer of strikers?
content: the premier league's summer of strikers is threatening to turn into a winter of woe . the trio entered November's international break with just six goals between them . england have been linked with a move to the uefa in the summer .

title: Men's Power Rankings: Biggest early-season risers
content: 81 points between the two proving that their lack of perimeter shooting isn't much of a factor . the Crimson Tide had elite guards, but it wasn't clear whether they had the frontcourt balance to make another deep run in March .

title: Five things that have made Patriots QB Drake Maye an MVP favorite
content: new England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye has made plenty of highlight-reel plays this season . he is the favorite to win the NFL's Most Valuable Player Award . maye has called the play 11 times this season for minus-13 yar .

title: 🏈 Bottom 10: BYU makes dreaded appearance!
content: the red Raiders take over deep in BYU territory after a muffed punt by Parker Kingston . "It's Getting Real in the Whole Foods parking lot," DJ Spider Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . the calendar hangs on the front of our refrigerator .

title: Week 12 preview: A wide-open ACC title race, key matchups and more
content: a slew of teams are teetering on a thin line between being in or out . this week features four ranked matchups that could shift the playoff picture dramatically . no. 9 Notre Dame's margin for error is zero as it faces a 7-2 Pittsburgh team .
